item.title: Mapping
item.description: OpenCV includes many functions for calibrating and mapping points and images between different spaces. Homography # A homography is a transformation that reorients one image to match or fit inside another: The two images are usually two points of view of the same subject. Common features are found in both images and paired to make a data set. Feature Matching + Homography to find Objects The data set is then used with the cv::findHomography function, which returns a matrix that allows us to warp one image into the other.
